comment.text:
I don't know why I've never written a review for this place. I've been going for years and it's definitely top tier.

The dedicated parking lot is a bit small but there's also paid street parking. 

Reservations are recommended as they can be pretty busy and the location is quite small. 

The charbroiled crab claws are to DIE for! So freaking delicious - I'm dreaming about when I can have them again. 

I wish I remembered the name of the frozen beverage I have but I recommend as it is super balanced and not overly sweet. I also had a fried catfish and shrimp basket - delicious! 

Overall 10/10 - no complaints whatsoever!

I can't believe I had never been here before but Bon Ton is such a gem and I'll definitely be going back. The food was *chefs kiss* made perfectly, the space has that NOLA aesthetic, and the service was great! There were people here as groups, on dates, and I imagine it would even be a cool place to go sit at the bar alone.

We started off with some oysters to share which I enjoyed, they were mild but tasty. Then we had planned to split the catfish banh me and the shrimp banh me, we accidentally got 2 catfish banh me's, so one was complimented to us and we still got the shrimp banh me. We absolutely DEVOURED all three (hence why I don't have a proper picture of the catfish one). Trust me when I say the catfish was soft, delicate, seasoned to perfection, and the shrimp was crispy, very clearly fried fresh, also cooked to perfection. Everything was amazing, I hear the bar upstairs has some fun events but I couldn't find it on the website, regardless, I will be back!

My visit to Bon Ton was a letdown, marred by several significant issues despite some culinary highlights. The fried chicken Po'boy and the étouffée, brimming with crawfish, were the only saving graces of the meal.

1) We were uncomfortably seated under a blasting air conditioner in the middle of winter, showing a lack of attention to temperature control. 

2) The mandatory 20% service charge was steep, considering the overall experience.

3) The most frustrating aspect was the deceptive pricing. Menu prices at the restaurant were shockingly 20-50% higher than those listed online, a classic bait-and-switch tactic. Coupled this with a mandatory 20% tip and you're paying $30 for a sandwich. 

4) A particular disappointment was the charbroiled oysters. Served barely cooked, they were unappetizing, and my attempt to address this issue was poorly handled. The manager took the partially eaten dish back to the kitchen (questionably against health regulations) for further cooking and still charged us for it, despite implying the contrary.

In summary, while there are some palatable dishes, the overall experience is overshadowed by misleading practices and questionable service. If I ever reconsider visiting, it would only be for a takeout sandwich, and I would have to mentally steel myself for the insane prices and fees. Proceed with caution.

I found a hidden gem!  Well it was hidden to me and a lot of others knew about it because it got pretty full as we were in there.  I was looking for a place to celebrate a friend birthday dinner after work, that had good crab legs.  Bon Ton came up on my Yelp search and after reading reviews, made a reservation.  The building front is of pink color and they do have their own dedicated, free parking, which is such a plus in Atlanta.  Walked in and they had just opened and there was one other table occupied.  I was greeted and asked if I had a reservation, which I did and was late for, but she was so pleasant and said that's ok and sat me and then brought me water while I waited for the others to arrive.  Such a cute, eclectic environment inside that I was enjoying just looking around at everything from artwork to light fixtures.  It's not a large place, but it never felt overly crowded and there is available outside seating.  They have a full bar, but they do have some specialty cocktails on the menu and I ordered a smoked bourbon Mai tai, which was a great choice that one of my friends ordered it for her second drink after tasting mine. We ordered three appetizers to share for the table; charbroiled crab claws, charbroiled oysters, and hot sticky chicken.  All the appetizers were beyond delicious.  The flavors were amazing that I just knew the entrees were going to be fabulous!  For entree I ordered the smoked crab legs and everyone followed suite and ordered the same thing. lol!  I have never had a smoked crab leg, but I will definitely come back and have them again.  The only thing to make note, the broth in the bowl for the crab legs is super spicy, so if you add potato's and corn and they are soaking in that broth, you will definitely have your nose running from the spice.  You know when the flavor is so good that you disregard the spice and just keep eating! The server/hostess was awesome and super friendly and prompt to get to the table and refill waters and remove empty plates.  Such an enjoyable experience.  We went outside to get a photo after dinner and the owner happened to be coming in and he popped in a photo with us.  Such a great reflection of the overall feel of Bon Ton

photos.caption: Smoked bourbon mai tai (minus the cherry because I ate it before taking the photo)
The owner popped in our photo

comment.text:
This is an interesting place serving vietnamese-creole dishes! Aesthetic is so pretty inside. Highly recommend making a reservation ahead of time especially if you don't want to sit at the bar. Vibes were great. 

We got the truffle mac n' cheese, crawfish etoufee bowl, and Bo Kho Bon Ton Rice Bowl. The etoufee bowl was so flavorful and my favorite of the nice. My partner also really likes the rice bowl and found it to be a good size to eat. The mac n' cheese was mediocre. They also seem to have a lot of interesting mixed drinks to try here as well!

photos.caption: Bo Kho Bon Ton Rice Bowl

comment.text:
Pleasantly surprised upon entering, Bon Ton is so cute inside.. 

My friend and I had 2:15 reservation. We arrived on time and was seated immediately. Our server Holly introduced herself in a timely manner. Holly was great at explaining the most ordered items on the menu.

PROS
Menu Variety 

Food - I ordered the Cajun Shrimp Burger and Red Beans & Rice. They were both good  however, I'll try something new when I return.
My friend ordered the House Boil and 5 Spice Broccoli which she enjoyed. 

The entire staff was really friendly.

CON
Parking

Came here for dinner on a business trip. Found this place on yelp and really want to try Cajun food, especially the etouffee.

Got the seasonal drink - yellow snow, which is the pretty fruity. I like it!

I got the crawfish etouffee. It was very tasty. Doesn't seem to be a big portion but I felt pretty stuffed after finishing it. 

My waiter was nice, checking on me occasionally but not too frequently. It was nice inside the restaurant: I sat close to the bar but it wasn't noisy. It was pretty crowded in a Thursday evening.

Been waiting to try BonTon for quite some time. I hate to say this, but o was truly underwhelmed. 
I must say I expected more, but it just wasn't there.

To start the boiled peanuts in crab boil was not what I expected. Living in New Orleans for over 10 years I thought this may be a nice touch. Truly it was a bowl of hot peanuts soaked in salt.

The crawfish mac and cheese seems to be what many patrons rave about. I will give it a 1/10. The 1 is for being piping hot when it came to the table. It's more or less velveeta shells and cheese with crawfish. Definitely not what I anticipated. 

 The one item that made the experience work it was the shrimp burger. Delicious. Fresh ingredients, perfectly seasoned and paired with the right condiments. 

In addition, cute little restaurant. Great ambiance and great selection of music.

photos.caption: Crawfish Smoked Gouda Mac and Cheese and Cajun Shrimp Burger

comment.text:
Okay stop the food was so good here ??? My man and I came here for a night out, very chill, and low maintenance. The vibe in here is so cool, there's actually a speakeasy upstairs and we decided not to go. We did grab a drink at the bar. Standard grey goose martini with olives for me of course. Ms bartender did her thing! I like my martini with no ice chips so I appreciate the extra strain. 

I ordered the shrimp étouffe, it comes with two hush puppies, and the five spice broccoli which had a lot of flavor. I had no idea étouffée was this good, and unfortunately have nothing to compare it to, but it was rich and creamy without having milk, and the shrimp was well seasoned. The rice was not over cooked, which is worth mentioning in my opinion! The broccoli was yummy, and crisp but I could not finish it all on account of being full from my main dish. 

I'm excited to come here again for another date night or with the girls and maybe even try the speakeasy upstairs!

I had dinner here with a friend, and they chose the restaurant... my friend has good taste indeed! 

Location and Parking 
Bon Ton is located in Midtown near Mary Macs. There is a small free parking lot behind the building, but if you go on the weekend like I did, you might have to park one street away and walk over. 

Venue and Atmosphere 
The restaurant is small, however it has two levels. The restaurant is on the main level and the bar is upstairs. The bar is bathed in red light with furry couches and a chill soundtrack. The main restaurant is bright with creole inspired decor. Restrooms are located both floors. Both levels were packed when we went on a Friday night. 

Service 
Service was prompt, courteous, and efficient. 

Food and Beverages 
I started with a half dozen oysters. The oysters were slightly salty but I fully dressed them as usual. I then ordered a crawfish étouffée entree. The dish was delicious and flavorful with the right amount of heat. The roux was also cooked perfectly. I sipped on a bourbon mai tai with my meal; it was strong yet sweet how I like it. 

Verdict 
I'll certainly be back during the week when there's less traffic lol.

Was able to get a last minute reservation after an outing me and a girlfriend had. We wanted to try one of the places on our IG list and the ppl did not lie! There was a variety to choose from. I had the charbroiled claws and Mac & Cheese. The crab was flavorful and the Mac was hearty and cheesy. I can definitely see coming back to try out more dishes. My friend had the shrimp burger and fries. Of course I tried one of her bon ton fries and they were seasoned well as well. Our servicer was nice and welcoming, drinks were tasty I had the Bon Ton Margarita. The upstairs had a speakeasy vibe that I loved and want to check out the next go round.

photos.caption: Smoked Gouda Mac and Cheese & Charbroiled Crab Claws

comment.text:
I love this spot for its Cajun creole seafood creativity. I come her often and was happy with my oyster house po boy and fried catfish Buford hwy sandwich. I was not happy by the default gratuity added to a party ot two. Our server was MIA A Lot and I had to flag her down. I expect good service if gratuity is added. Else please change price of the entree so we
Know what to expect.

photos.caption: Buford highway spicy. Catfish fried banj mi

comment.text: Great music with a nice atmosphere. Really enjoyed the charbroiled crab claw entree. It was very flavorful and delicious

I've been to both bonton and their speakeasy located upstairs, the waiting room.

I found the drinks at the waiting room to be better and much less sugary. The crab claws at bonton are very good as was the shrimp poboy. 

Overall this was a great late night dining experience. Both places have such a cute vibe.
The food is average and pricey, but the staff are friendly and helpful. I also love the ambiance.

This is a cute resturant with great food! The crab claws were EXCELLENT! May I have that crab claw sauce to go?! I had the shrimp basket and the table had the shrimp burger, étouffée & crab cake. We also had the margaritas which were pricey for the amount but tasty nonetheless.  My only complaint was the service! It seems they were understaffed but listen, your attitude goes a long way. Both servers made us feel as if we were an inconvenience dining in their restaurant. TUH! Could it be that since gratuity was already applied, they didn't care?! I would visit again but probably sit at the bar or in their upstairs speakeasy.

You know how it feels when you go to your cousins house for dinner? That's what the service was like for us here. Our server Saaghir was A M A Z I N G! He was friendly, funny, personable, knew the menu inside and out, and made great suggestions. 

The food was also super good! We ordered the Shrimp Étouffée, Shrimp Po Boy, Shrimp Burger, Shrimp Bahn Mi, Mussels, fries, and broccoli. I would recommend any one of these items. The broccoli is seasoned with five spice and is so good! Everything was seasoned to perfection. High five to the kitchen staff! Y'all doing it back there!

We will 100% be back for more and I highly recommended trying this spot 10/10!

I'm in between a 3 and 4. I'll Lean towards 4 bc there are more thigns I wanted to try. 

Good- 
The etouffe bowl was delicious. 
The catfish bowl was yummy 

Eh- 
Bon ton fries- limp and not flavorful 
Shrimp burger- eh 
Service was super slow 
A lot of things were not available and the menu is much smaller than the one online

Ok first of all, they said their crawfish is "fresh". As someone who lived in New Orleans, I can in fact confirm that this is false, unless by fresh, they mean fresh out of the freezer. Their crawfish is definitely frozen, and the meat is dry and shriveled and not good. I will say that the sauce they put it in is delicious, but $15/lb for frozen crawfish is robbery. It was also an extremely small portion, it couldn't have been more than .75 lbs. The shrimp is much better in their sauce. Shrimp is headless so a pound is a good amount for one person. Their boil sauce is a bit spicy, very good, and not overloaded in oil and garlic the way many Cajun/Asian boil places do it.

Ordered corn and it was still cold lol so they use frozen corn too and didn't heat it all the way. When I say cold, I don't mean not warm, I mean actually like it could've been sitting in the refrigerator because it was chilled. I still ate the cold corn because the sauce tastes good, but jeez between the previously frozen crawfish and frozen corn, this cannot get higher than three stars.

Our server was very nice but wasn't the most knowledgeable. Especially since she insisted the crawfish was "fresh". The atmosphere in the restaurant was sort of fun, a bit loud and music blasting. 20% service charge is included.

Drinks were good. I got a sweet frozen drink and it was definitely very sweet but good.

The smoked snow crab was definitely interesting. It was $38 for 2.1 clusters. It was fine to split between two people, but the flavor overload was too much for one person to eat all the crab alone. With all the smoke plus Cajun seasoning and salt, it was great to try and a great dish to split amongst 2-3 people, but would've been overwhelming to eat more than one cluster.

Overall, I might come here again for drinks, shrimp, and maybe try some of sides - if I feel like spending a lot of money for not-fine dining. But definitely avoid the crawfish.

Being from Charleston (seafood lol) I turned this place down the first time my significant other mentioned it. I finally agreed once we had an event in the area to go to and all the other restaurants on our list were already booked up... I will admit I was wrong putting my nose up to this place! It's decent quality seafood at good prices, a fun atmosphere, and friendly service. Their cocktails are good too and reasonably priced. Thoroughly enjoyed it and would return!

photos.caption: Boiling Pt. Peanuts  Boil House Sausage and Seafood Gumbo

comment.text: Food and drinks were awesome. The vibes are cool, and the decor is really awesome. My only complaint was the wait staff. The waitresses were not friendly. Customer service is a job where you have to deal with people. These girls did not seem thrilled to wait on us or answer any questions we had about the menu. They were very short with us and had short patience. Not to mention, they charged us $2 for extra bread that came with our crab claws.

My husband and I walked in for a reservation and was seated immediately, yet every waiter walked past us for 20 minutes. No one asked if we were ok, if we wanted water, if we wanted apps, drinks, nothing. Everyone walked past our table multiple times with out so much as a hello. Even when making eye contact with waiters/waitresses, they actively ignored me. I waited 20 mins before speaking to a random staff person who walked by and asked him if anyone was going to give us service. 

The food is lack luster at best. For a restaurant that boasts Cajun and Vietnamese fusion, you would expect each dish to be bursting with flavor. Every dish was poorly seasoned, my drink was watered down (especially given the price). I did not finish my food and there is a mandatory 20% gratuity, which is high given the poor service I received. The only upside to this restaurant is that there is a Krispy Kreme down the street. Save your money and time.

Pretty solid spot! Definitely hit or miss depending on what you order. For the apps, we ordered the crab claws. A little expensive for the portion I suppose, but they were reallllly tasty. For my main, I had the shrimp burger, and I will be talking about that burger for a long time because it was so good. I'm giving 4 instead of 5 stars because my friend's crab cake was sub par in my opinion and service was just ok. I would come back specifically for that shrimp burger though. Seriously, order it!

This place is a great hip spot to grab food at. We made a reservation and we were seated quickly. Parking is a bit difficult here. We parked on the street bc there were no spots in their small lot.

I got a iced coffee which was delicious. The rest of the food we ate family style. I think my favorite was the mac and cheese. I liked the oysters as well. The amount of food for the price is kind of small, but it tastes pretty good. Their dessert is quite yummy.

photos.caption: Crawfish Smoked Gouda Mac and Cheese

comment.text:
We had a lovely time at this sparkly purple little Cajun spot near downtown. Visiting Atlanta for a few days and decided to try something different... this place was divine. Loved everything about it! Quaint, chic, quirky (furry wall to where?) mellow vibe, great prices. We sampled a few food options and everything was delightful - perfectly seasoned with the right amount of spice, arrived super fast and hot. The cocktails are strong and thoughtfully concocted. Our waitress was attentive and sweet. 
There were so many more menu items I want to try.  I'll definitely be back when I return to ATL!

photos.caption: Red Beans and Rice, Smoked Gouda Mac and Cheese, Roast Beef Po' Boy, Hurricane, Mezcal Margarita, Etouffee

comment.text:
Liked this place. From walking through the door the host was helpful and welcoming. We went upstairs to "The Waiting Room" very nice vibes. The bartender was amazing and so were the drinks.

I was excited to go to this restaurant with some friends after seeing them on instagram. I had been dreaming about having the charbroiled crab claws, but was sadly disappointed when I was told by the waitress they were sold out. I had a reservation for Friday night at 8:15pm and thought since Friday evenings are busy that they'd have them. I ordered the Bon Ton Bahn Mi and the shrimp po'boy. The entrees were amazing, but sad about those crab claws still. I will probably try to come back during the week in hopes the appetizer is available.
Smoked crab legs were the best on the menu. Chris served us and was great! Cool speakeasy upstairs.

Ate here with friends tonight and overall everything was pretty good! We started with gumbo, which is super spicy & should come with a warning lol, I had the crawfish etoufee and it is very flavorful! Our drinks were perfect (Marci grad margaritas).
They had the smoked crab legs and they said they were good too but let down from the Mac n Cheese with crawfish due to its looser texture but not terrible. Great experience we will be back! The service was good and the atmosphere was real chill.

photos.caption: Mac n Crawfish Smoked Gouda Mac and Cheese

comment.text:
Torn on this spot. Pros: funky/fun atmosphere, fun staff! 

Cons: parking sucks. Some of the dishes are your normal fried seafood, nothing special. People who are into the Vietnamese menu items might like the food a bit more. They were out of Mexican coke.  

Overall it's not bad, but also not somewhere I feel the need to go back - though I might go to try the crab legs boil as that's not easy to find in the city.

My sister raved about the smoked crab legs and I couldn't wait to visit to try them. 

We had an 8:30pm reservation and were seated once we arrived. Our server Chris was good until we couldn't find him to pay our tab. But otherwise, service was good. 

Bon Ton is a small, intimate spot with a scrumptious looking menu. My sister ordered the boiled peanuts and hush puppies as an appetizer and we got the smoked crab legs and potatoes as our entrees. 

The peanuts are so good!  Spicy but still have a crunch to them. You can tell they're not sitting in water all day because the texture was not mushy at all. The hush puppies were basic to me and only tasted good if you dipped them in the accompanying sauce. 

The crab legs are everything!  I don't know whose idea it was to smoke crab legs but I thank them!  They were cooked perfectly as the meat came right out the shell and the flavor was like a kiss from heaven.  The potatoes were good too but I didn't eat many since I was all into the crab legs. 

I also ordered the lemonade made Bon Ton style and I highly suggest you try it as well. 

If you have time and are looking for something different, make a reservation for Bon Ton and enjoy!

Had a business shindig in the new upstairs room with about 15 people. Mostly a fixed menu but a good variety so I feel I got a good flavor of the food. 
Very friendly and patient waitress (Mick). Poor lady had a lot to deal with but was so professional and pleasant. 
Great variety of vegetarian/fish dishes for our family and meat dishes for the rest of the group. 
Starter salad had some awesome pickled veggies. I had the blackened catfish and the wife had the chickpea etouffee. My dish was very good but hers was outstanding.  Good depth of flavor with the right amount of heat for her. 

Great vibe, great food, great service. Look forward to heading back and trying from the menu.

There are so many bonuses to this spot. Perfect for a date or girls night out, and will not disappoint. Even if you sit at the bar. The parking is limited and tight but not hard to find within their lot. 
Check in at the table, and be mindful to stand inside as it's a bit tight. However, seating doesn't take super long.

The food is incredible, served hot and suuuuper tasty if you enjoy Cajun food. They know  seafood!! 

The staff here is excellent. I have to say they know how to serve with style and grace. My bestie and I enjoyed Christmas drinks and picked at a few things:
Fried Oysters  
Hush puppies
Crab  cake 

It was pretty busy for a late-ish dinner. We got reservations for 9PM (strongly recommend) and it was such a great ambiance, from large groups, to small ones, to couples. Grab those peanuts! They are great for picking and compliment everything. Truly superb experience.

photos.caption: Christmas  decorations to match the drinks.

comment.text: Now has become my go too spot for great food and drinks. The bar tenders are always nice and friendly even if not to each other lol. I have tried several things On the menu and can't wait to go back to try more! Upstairs is a like a speak easy bar nice DJ and love the hand seats.

Visited Atlanta with some friends for the long weekend and came here upon a friend's recommendation and was super glad we did. My first time trying creole Vietnamese fusion, where they infuse pho flavours into their boils and it certainly did not disappoint.  

We ordered the boiled peanuts (a nice appetizer), crayfish boil, shrimp boil and snow crab boil. All were extremely fresh but the snow crab had to be my favourite. We added the option to add corn (a great way to appreciate the boil seasonings) and potatoes (highly recommend!).  

All in all a delicious meal and quite affordable.  Tip us automatically included in the bill.  I'd definitely come back again.

photos.caption: Snow crab plus boil add on corn and potatoes

comment.text:
OVERALL: Bon Ton is a really cool concept, but I think the details need refining. It seems like the quality is hit or miss depending on the night and what you order. I would give it another shot but am not rushing back.

PARKING: Oh my god a nightmare. The lot fills up quickly, you cannot street park on side streets after 5PM (resident only), and you can't park at Mary Mac's. Your only option if you can't get in their lot is to park somewhere on the side of Ponce. We spent 20 mins trying to find parking. Plan accordingly! Or Uber!

FOOD: I've sampled a lot, and here are my takes for each. 
- The crispy chicken is a must! So tasty, lots of herbs!
- If you like them, the hush puppies are great as a side!
- The papaya salad we ordered either came undressed as a mistake, or it was not good. There were very few, super finely chopped herbs (adding no flavor), no peanuts, and no evidence of sauce? We meant to ask the waitress, but didn't get a chance. 
- Meatballs are good but nothing special. The sauce that comes with is what would distinguish the dish from-- except it's too thin to grab the meat! We ended up pouring it over the papaya salad.
- Buford hwy style oyster/catfish po boy we're both good, but absolutely not numbing spicy from the szechuan oil, or spicy at all. Again, the seafood itself was tasty, but not what I expected. 
- Cauliflower falafel banh mi was the only really veg-friendly item on the menu, and it contains nuts despite not being labeled... It also was lackluster. Ours came as just the patty, with very very few herbs, no jalapeños, etc. Nothing like a banh mi. 
- In the future, I would stick to a seafood boil or fried seafood here. 

DRINKS: All cocktails ordered were tasty! Lots of options, mostly classic cocktails with a spin of some sort.

VIBE + SERVICE: Incredible. Everyone's friendly, the decor is trendy and has a sort of "underground" feel with the dark lighting against neon + tiki decor. Lots of outdoor seating and an upstairs bar as well (which we did not visit!)

Sat at the bar. Don't remember his name, but the bartender guy with long hair provided excellent customer service. He also had a great singing voice. 

Ambiance was sophisticated-casual with nostalgic classics by various artists playing at a comfortable volume. The employees were friendly and professional. 

Food prices were affordable for moderate portion sizes. I ordered a seafood boil with asian fusion style boiled peanuts as an appetizer. 

The flavor was good but don't expect to experience New Orleans in a dish. Enjoyed it though! 

Overall, It's was a chill vibe. Great place to catch up with friends. Craft cocktails were delectable. I recommend.

The food was amazing. My mom brought me here unaware it got viral on Instagram. Ambiance was laid back and calm which I really liked. Like it felt homie which is enjoyable versus a large restaurant. Our server, Holly was really good. Service was a little slow but nothing on her part because she's the only server (ps: please get the woman some help, she did phenomenal helping everyone on her own). Will definitely be back again

photos.caption: Sausage, Beans, and Rice Plate in a Bowl

comment.text:
We loved the food, the staff, and the atmosphere.
Our server gave us complimentary boiled peanuts since it was or first time @ non ton.  First time with Cajun boiled peanuts, I couldn't stop eating them.  
We had hush puppies, gumbo, bin ton rice bowl, and a bon ton burger.
Everting was cooked perfectly, not to spicy , a kick but nothing that was distracting from the flavors.
Portion was good, we had some left over to take home, and the price is not bad either considering your in mid-town Atlanta.

photos.caption: Bob ton burger, low carb version
BOWL of gumbo, hush puppy basket
Boiled peanuts, fantastic made with a Cajun boil.

comment.text: The service was great and the food was amazing. I would definitely go back again. The hostess was very professional and efficient with our order. The food was served at a great temperature.

What a wonderful place for a meal. We were heading to a show at the Fox. Made reservations here because the menu looks really good. The service was outstanding . The food was amazing! There were only 2 of us dining. I had the shrimp boil an my goodness there was way too many shrimp. My fried ordered the blackened catfish bowl. She raved about the flavors . Thanks for great food and amazing service
Good vibes. I loved the Shrimp burger and the Red beans and rice were a good combo. It can get loud in the evening but overall good vibes.

photos.caption: Cajun Shrimp Burger & Red Beans and Rice

comment.text:
One of my new favorite spots in town!

I randomly came upon Bon Ton one day while scrolling through Yelp, and wow, what a great day that was! Being a lover of seafood and Cajun food, I was immediately drawn to Bon Tok. I couldn't believe that I had been missing out on such a gem since I moved to ATL, so I had to make my way there asap. 

My first visit was a solo one. I love nothing more than enjoying a new place, country, restaurant or experience solo dolo. It allows me the opportunity to take my time and savor each moment without rush or a care. And I'm so glad that I did that! First thing to note: there's not a huge parking lot here. I'd *guess* that there's about 2 dozen or so spots right outside the restaurant. BUT - there are about a half dozen street parking spots close by and more up the street, and then some. So on a busy night, you may have a 2min walk - totally worth it!

When you see Bon Ton, you won't miss it lol. It's bubblegum pink! It's like they knew I was coming. I'm just drawn to it! Upon entry, it's super dim and chill, with a busy kitchen to your right, a dimly lit staircase in front of you and a lively bar and dining room to your left. It's truly a gorgeous spot that had some love put into the decor, it feels like you're in someone's fabulous vintage living room lol. 

The dining room is so aesthetically pleasing with its gorgeous highlighted art pieces and decor. Seating is limited, but I have no complaints there as it feels super intimate and keeps down on the noise for the most part. On all visits, I was seated quickly and given a great spot to enjoy all the corners of the lower level. Service is really great here! Better on a weekday/earlier evening, as when I visited on a Friday night our server was so lovely but seemed to be managing lots of tables. I do love that I saw multiple team members assisting in cleaning tables, bringing drinks out and more. I ordered a beer on my second visit that wasn't brought out when expected so after about 20min or so I asked another team member. It was brought out quickly after by that team member. Our server came back and explained that it was just a slip of the mind after needing to check on stock - and I really appreciated even hearing the transparency!! Sh*T happens, lol! I've been a bartender and waiter, And I asked for a random beer that may not be a regular choice lol. When it got to me, it was ice cold and they were so sweet to even remove it from my receipt. I would have been happy to pay for it and was really appreciative of the transparency and quick moves to pour it up once I asked. :)

Onto the food. Bomb. The boiled peanuts are what initially brought me here lol. I love boiled peanuts, it's the country, south Floridian part of me lol so I had to try these! And their menu blew my mind because Cajun + Asian Fusion *+ Seafood all wrapped into one?! Yes please! The peanuts were SO good! (My second time around could have been better but it was late! You bet I'll be back for another back ASAP) I've ordered the gumbo twice now and WOW. Thick, flavorful, savory, delicious - just fire. The crawfish Mac & cheese? Fire, made with patience and love. The oysters are very good, but I don't think they will be my go-to after I've tried some really awesome oysters in town, but absolutely delicious choice. And the Po Boys?! PHEW. I tried the Nashville Hot Catfish and y'all. Please go get that baby (to go maybe because I need a seat to sit and watch my K-dramas while I mind my business - pls?)  and enjoy!! The catfish portion was heftyyyy, the bread was fresh, the veggies crisp, the hot sauce so spicy and yummy. 

A spicy, flavorful Cajun heaven. 

If you see me at Bon Ton with my face in a bowl of gumbo and a fistful of boiled peanuts shells, please mind your business and just enjoy your delicious meal as I will definitely enjoy mine! :-P

photos.caption: Slaw, Gumbo and Crawfish Smoked Gouda Mac and Cheese
Crawfish Smoked Gouda Mac and Cheese
Awesome beer recommendation from my waitress!

comment.text: Super fun place! Great vibe! Went there to enjoy their crawfish, which had a great taste. Wish the portions were a bit larger. The food was very flavorful. The fried shrimp and oysters were delicious. The crab legs were also yummy. Super cool vibe with the corner table with pink fur. Bit expensive but we super enjoyed the crawfish. The service was a bit slow but fun place to go check out.
One of my faves in Atlanta love the smoked crablegs the food is always good here drinks are creative and strong.

Absolutely loved! We were looking for a cute brunch place last minute and glad we found this spot, it was pretty easy to make a reservation, and I love that they have a free parking lot which can be rare downtown! The menu is expansive with vegan options, and even mocktails. Cajun Vietnamese is a cool combo concept and did not disappoint. We had the falafel banh mi, fries, crawfish etouffee and Mac and cheese. Definitely good and and not too pricey. Good portions and had plenty of leftovers. Our servers were sweet and had good recommendations and personality. Definitely will be back

The ambiance was very lively, and the server was very friendly and responsive. For my beverage, I enjoyed the cherry limeade. For my appetizer, I had the fantabulous crab cake. For my main entrée, I had the incredibly delicious jumbo shrimp (fried). As my side, I had the macaroni and cheese, which was awesomely delicious. For dessert, I had the apple pie, which was off the chain.

photos.caption: Crawfish Smoked Gouda Mac and Cheese

comment.text: Definitely need a reservation because the place is small but very busy.  The food was ok...some really good...some was just "ok" and some not so great.  The lighting is dim so it was hard to get good pictures.  The flavor of the "boil" was really good.

photos.caption: Spicy Jicama and Papaya Salad, Hush Puppies,
Hard to get good photos because of the lighting but the food was good

comment.text:
For a $60 tab with an automatic 20% gratuity was way too much. Especially since our server never refilled our drinks or checked in with us unless it was to tell us that the kitchen's backed up. We were understanding of that so we tried to ask for the food to-go but she turned her back on us multiple times. Also, the table behind us received their food before us and they came after us by half an hour. Our reservation was pointless. 

The food was mediocre... I'd rather go to a restaurant where they specialize in Viet food or Cajun food. For the review that said the crawfish was frozen, agreed!!

Tip - ask for the wait time even if the kitchen's backed up or you may be at risk of the hangry/waiting game. 

Stars are for the restaurant vibe and the other hostess/server who was very sweet. 

This visit was unfortunately a miss for us. A second chance would be better off supporting another restaurant.

Excellent service. Great atmosphere. True Atlanta gem. 

Drinks are no good - I got the tasteless gentleman which was truly tasteless. Too much ice too little ginger. Kinda like a weak penicillin drink.  Followed up with a French 75 which was a little better but still exceptionally disappointing. 

Food - it's ok. Catfish is excellent the fries a bit salty.  Oysters were ok nothing special. The star is the Mac and cheese. Get it and enjoy. 

The papaya salad is greatly disappointing if you're used to authentic Thai or Viet but if not then I'm sure you will enjoy it.

My husband had been wanting to come to this place for weeks for his birthday. We made it a pint to travel on a Sunday over an hour to make sure we made it happen. OMG what a mistake! We ordered our food (a catfish po-boy, a shrimp po-boy, 2 burgers, Bonton fries, and Mac and cheese. Listen it was overpriced and unflavorful. I wanted the crab fingers (which are a pretty frequent item all over their menu) they were out of crab fingers or any crab! I asked if I could get some fresh fries, I never received them! The waitress never said a thing! She came back to the table to let me know that the fries were removed. Absolutely they were because I never received them!? My son (who eats everything) barely touched his Mac n cheese. My kids enjoyed the burgers ($12 Jo the burger only) however it was so small. Really the size of a kids meal burger but on a standard menu. I don't know if we came on an off day or what but it was pretty empty and the food was lackluster! So they have an automatic tip of 20% no matter what size party you have. We asked if our tip could be removed and we provide our own gratuity based on our overall experience. Besides my husband wanted this for weeks and it was a let down! 

After we requested this the manager came over and debated with a horrible attitude. She proceeded to debate with us about why she would not remove the gratuity and making excuses for the poor overall experience and food! She stood over us and berated us for not telling her step by step on each item of food we did not like! All because we only asked that she remove the gratuity. We didn't ask for any food to be removed were were prepared to pay as agreed! We let her know we were unwilling to pay the gratuity. She then stormed off and said "don't pay then". 

The hostess who was definitely more mild came over and we gave her the cash for the meal. Not sure if it was a bad day, bad manager, or what but the overall experience was terrible and one we will never forget as a family.
